subject: Suvudu Cage Match
event:
The results are in for the first two brackets of the Suvudu cage matches.

<lj-embed id="36"/>


Meanwhile, brackets three and four are still on-going, and Jaime Lannister is locked in his death struggle with that witch from Hogwart's.  You can weigh in at:

http://www.suvudu.com/2010/03/cage-match-2010-round-1-15-jaime-lannister-versus-18-hermione-granger.html

comments.article: Elric can't have lost.
comments.subject: Match smatch

comments.article:
Rolands guns
bullets
Elric's head
SPLAT!!!!

fight over
comments.subject: Re: Match smatch

comments.article: Oh dear. Despite the delusional voting of some muggles, poor Jaime doesn't stand a chance there... :)

If you don't take these matches seriously, it's actually quite fun to watch the results and read the comments :)

I feel like a true geek for known almost all of these.
comments.subject: It's fun

comments.article:
Mr. Martin,

Since this is a question probably only you could answer, would Jaime even kill a woman? Especially since is the "nicer" Feast Jaime. I guess if it's life and death I could seeing Jaime doing what he had to do, but do you have any control over the ending to prevent characters doing something that they would never do. I know you are opposed to fan fiction but with something as loose as informal as this I wonder if you will just let them write whatever they feel.

I voted, but I saw the next match and...

Shoot, why did it have to be Cthulhu? ;_; I mean, it's Cthulhu, he can take all the contestants at once ;_;
See, everybody says that, but as I recall he's a slow starter.  The guy had to sink back under the waves after some random Lovecraftian protagonists hit him in the head with a 1920s era yacht.
jaime is doing well.
I can't believe how many awesome characters are missing from this tourney. Why does JKR get two characters? Where is Pug?
comments.subject: Missing......

comments.article:
Exactly - we get Hermione, but not Milamber???
Geeeezzz......
comments.subject: Re: Missing......

comments.article: They liked my quote!! Thanks George, I never would have seen that video without this link. Hope I make Jaime proud by slinging insults at his opponent next round!
comments.subject: My quote!

comments.article: That was epic imagery there Bill ^_^
comments.subject: Re: My quote!

comments.article: ... we want your comment for the next round too! We want to see if you can come up with a story such that Jaime wins against Big C!
comments.subject: Please...

comments.article: Jamie is trouncing her :D
So far this has been the funnest March Madness ever!  Next year I wanna see Gregor Clegane versus Rubeus Hagrid!

I've enjoyed the madness so far.

There are a lot of fantasy stalwarts missing, however. If they do this again, next time they really need to include Fafhrd & the Grey Mouser (as a team, of course), Cugel the Clever, Jirel of Joiry, Thomas Covenant, someone from GORMENGHAST, someone from Eddison's WORM OUROBOROS, Stoker's Dracula (I mean, if they are going to have the sparkly kid from TWILIGHT, why not a real vamp?), one of Tad Williams' crew from MEMORY, SORROW, AND THORN, FitzChivalry FarSeer, Merlin (I like T.H. White's version, but any Merlin will do) and maybe Morgan Le Fey and Lancelot as well, Corwin of Amber (or maybe Benedict of Amber, come to think of it), Dream of the Endless, John Brunner's Traveller in Black...
comments.subject: they coulda been contenders

comments.article: I personally cant see how they justified putting Aslan in this cage match. HE IS GOD. That's completely unfair, if he so desires he can unravel reality around his opponent, and sent them into oblivion, or jump through time and space and stop their birth/creation. There is no number to the reasons why Aslan is too powerful, and shouldn't have been included. Peter would have been a better option. I also agree with you, they should have had Sir Camaris, or Sir Simon Snowlock in the match, maybe even Jiriki i-Sa'onserei. Also disappointed in the His dark Materials character choice Lyra common she is a weak little girl no special powers regular human for all intents an purposes. They should have chosen Will Perry, with the Subtle Knife that can cut though anything, or Iorek Byrnison, a huge armored bear, who is extremely intelligent, a great fighter, and a master blacksmith.
comments.subject: Re: they coulda been contenders

comments.article: I'm just completely blown away that Jim Butcher voted *AGAINST his own creation, Harry Dresden! =boggles=

what why

it's fucking conan the barbarian
I just voted. Lannister is up 76%-24%, total votes number past 16,000. I think Lannister has got this in the bag.
sadly these cage matches are just turning into popularity contests. also sad there is no one from the malazan series in it.
Kruppe FTW :D

They quoted one of my posts!

Although he mispronounced my name... odd for a fantasy guy to not be familiar with "Archon"...

Anyway, I missed guys from the Malazan series too... as well as Leiber's Fahfrd and the Grey Mouser... Any of David Gemmel's protagonists... David Farland's Runelords guys... Colby Callistinson from MZR's series...etc... but the list is still pretty cool... Some of the Malazan characters would be awesome simply because they could hang with some of the more powerful god-like characters on the list... I love Jaime Lannister as a character more than pretty much anyone on that list... but truthfully he's way overmatched by some of those guys, especially without his hand he's easily the worst sword-banger in the tourney... I said they should have taken the Mountain, that way even if one of those supernatuarlly fast sword-swingers ran him through, he could still win ala Red Viper style...
comments.subject: Woo-Hoo!

comments.article: I would have entered The Hound. If he is still around.....
comments.subject: Re: Woo-Hoo!

comments.article:
LOL i loved your comment about tyrion slipping out of the shadows slitting hermione's ribs "a Lannister always pays his debts" HAHA

I the bit about the broken teeth, clearly pictured it on my mind, was pricless, seriously, i cant see Jaime ever losing to her
comments.subject: lmao o george

comments.article: So far this has been the funnest March Madness ever!  Next year I wanna see Gregor Clegane versus Rubeus Hagrid!

I really think they should have left the various god-like beings out of this bracket, namely Aslan and Cthulhu, but I guess a few of the others are close to that level, maybe.  Maybe make another bracket for that level of being, but reserve this bracket for heroes and even villains of various types: sorcerers, swordsmen, gunslingers, and starfighters should be the only ones allowed here.  Otherwise it's too unbalanced and unfair.
comments.subject: Gods and other beings.

comments.article:
How about Achmed the Snake from Elizabeth Haydon's Rhapsody books? He is a pretty good assassin type.

I still think Pug/Milamber would destroy everybody but Aslan. How do you stop a guy who can destroy the world you are standing on and escape through a portal to a new one.
comments.subject: Missing

comments.article:
That many? Woot! :-)

But I'm confused. How does one vote? I've only been able to find the comment threads (and did post arguments for Jaime winning there), and didn't realise there was an actual poll. Feel pretty daft...
comments.subject: Re: Jaime's #1! Jaime's #1!

comments.article: I certainly voted for Jaime over Hermione, but I'm not sure I can in good conscience say that he stands even a hint of a chance against Cthulu.
comments.subject: Jaime vs. Cthulu...

comments.article: I say Jaime gets the upset when the 7 do a run-in at the end. Beware the Stranger :(
I keep trying to leave my vote, but it won't keep me logged in long enough to do it and it's getting really annoying. Go Jamie!
